data.title: Pulp to headline Hogmanay - News
data.meta_description: Pulp have been confirmed as headliners for the 30th anniversary concert in the Princes Street Gardens.
data.text:
Organisers of Edinburgh’s Hogmanay today announced that cultural icons Pulp will headline the 30th anniversary concert in the Princes Street Gardens on Sunday 31 December.

The event will welcome party-people from around the globe to dance their way into 2024 at the world-famous New Year festival. Pulp announced a surprise 2023 reunion and ran of sell-out summer shows.

The headline appearance at Edinburgh’s Hogmanay marks the Sheffield band’s first live show in the capital for over 20 years. They will perform the last show of 2023 and first of 2024.

Fronted by Jarvis Cocker, Pulp has provided the soundtrack to a generation.

The Concert in the Gardens will be a hit filled set of career spanning pop anthems. These include Common People, Disco 2000, and Do You Remember the First Time?

Their set will bring in the bells beneath the majestic backdrop of Edinburgh Castle amidst one of the world’s greatest New Year firework displays. Pulp will once again help make Edinburgh the best New Year party on the planet.

What's on at Edinburgh's Hogmanay?

The world-famous Edinburgh’s Hogmanay Street Party will also welcome 40,000 revellers into Edinburgh's city centre and Princes Street.

Crowds will party their way into 2024 with friends, old and new, from around the world, counting down to the spectacular midnight moment.

Street Party revellers won’t miss out on Pulp’s headline set. The full performance and DJ soundtracks will be broadcast to screens throughout Princes Street in the Pop Zone with spectacular effects.

This will create one massive city centre party.

The Tartan Zone on Waverley Bridge, presents a night of foot-stomping music from across Scotland. It will be headlined by the award-winning Elephant Sessions, joined by the incredible Kinnaris Quintet.

This element will open with and exhilarating hour of energetic ceilidh dancing from the islands with the Hannah Fisher Band.

Expanded Hogmanay programme

An expanded four-day programme of world-class events will run from Friday 29 December 2023 to Monday 1 January 2024. The full Edinburgh’s Hogmanay programme and ticket details will be released in the coming weeks.

Other confirmed events taking place over the four-day Edinburgh Hogmanay 2023 / 2024 festival include the return of the Torchlight Procession (29 December) with presenting partner EventScotland.

This particular event is in support of homeless charity Social Bite.

The Night Afore Disco Party (30 December) beneath Edinburgh Castle will also return. There will be a packed programme of free New Year’s Day events for young and old.

Ticket details

The Concert in the Gardens with Pulp takes place on Sunday 31 December 2023 in the West Princes Street Gardens from 9pm to 12.50am. Special guests are to be announced.

Tickets go on general release on Friday 29 September at 10am. They're priced from £75.00, including booking fees and a 50p charity donation.

A limited Concert in the Gardens pre-sale is available from Thursday 28 September at 10am.

Edinburgh’s Hogmanay Street Party tickets are on-sale now, priced £28.50 including fees and charity donation. There are discounted EH postcode resident Street Party tickets, priced £23.50 including fees and charity donation.

Tickets for the Street Party Silent Disco with Silent Adventure are priced £7.50 including fees. These require a full Street Party ticket to purchase.

Spaces for the Silent Disco Zone are limited and available on a first-come-first-served basis.

50p from every Concert in the Gardens and Street Party ticket purchased will be donated to homeless charity Social Bite. Additional on-line donations can be made when purchasing tickets.

Tickets for both the Edinburgh’s Hogmanay Street Party and Torchlight Procession events are available from 10am, Friday 25 August.

Details of further Edinburgh’s Hogmanay 2023 / 2024 events will be announced in October.

Buy or register for (pre-sale) tickets on edinburghshogmanay.com
